issue.title: Remove like/+1 buttons at bottom of post
issue.body:
At the bottom of an individual post, it says: "Loved what you just read? Share it!" 

How can I remove this text and the share icons from every post?

comment.body:
Yup, I didn't know you already had it, and I prefer to overwrite the least amount of things possible to be future proof, even if Monologue is not changing so much.


On Apr 12, 2016, 8:25 AM -0400, Nitin Savant<notifications@github.com>, wrote:
>  
> That definitely works. Another option (that I went with) is to comment the line below from the "show.html.erb" file.
>  
>  
> <%= render "monologue/posts/social_sharing" %>
>  
>  
> —
> You are receiving this because you modified the open/close state.
> Reply to this email directly orview it on GitHub(https://github.com/jipiboily/monologue/issues/286#issuecomment-208878517)
>  
>  
>

How can I remove this text and the share icons from every post?

comment.body: Overwrite [this file](https://github.com/jipiboily/monologue/blob/master/app/views/monologue/posts/_social_sharing.html.erb) at the exact same location in your project with a blank file and you should be good.

issue.title: Using SKIP LOCKED on Postgres 9.5
issue.body:
It looks like `lock_head` is a perfect candidate for the new SKIP LOCKED feature in Postgres 9.5: http://michael.otacoo.com/postgresql-2/postgres-9-5-feature-highlight-skip-locked-row-level/

If I'm not missing something then using SKIP LOCKED `lock_head` can be simplified to this:

```sql
UPDATE queue_classic_jobs
SET locked_at = now(), locked_by = pg_backend_pid()
WHERE id IN (
  SELECT id FROM queue_classic_jobs
  WHERE locked_at IS NULL AND q_name = $1 AND scheduled_at <= now()
  LIMIT 1
  FOR NO KEY UPDATE SKIP LOCKED
)
RETURNING *
```

comment.body: This project is deprecated. I don't recall how it works at all. Everything from this gem is included in more recent versions of Spree AFAIK.

issue.title: Using SKIP LOCKED on Postgres 9.5
issue.body:
It looks like `lock_head` is a perfect candidate for the new SKIP LOCKED feature in Postgres 9.5: http://michael.otacoo.com/postgresql-2/postgres-9-5-feature-highlight-skip-locked-row-level/

If I'm not missing something then using SKIP LOCKED `lock_head` can be simplified to this:

```sql
UPDATE queue_classic_jobs
SET locked_at = now(), locked_by = pg_backend_pid()
WHERE id IN (
  SELECT id FROM queue_classic_jobs
  WHERE locked_at IS NULL AND q_name = $1 AND scheduled_at <= now()
  LIMIT 1
  FOR NO KEY UPDATE SKIP LOCKED
)
RETURNING *
```

issue.title: Using SKIP LOCKED on Postgres 9.5
issue.body:
It looks like `lock_head` is a perfect candidate for the new SKIP LOCKED feature in Postgres 9.5: http://michael.otacoo.com/postgresql-2/postgres-9-5-feature-highlight-skip-locked-row-level/

If I'm not missing something then using SKIP LOCKED `lock_head` can be simplified to this:

```sql
UPDATE queue_classic_jobs
SET locked_at = now(), locked_by = pg_backend_pid()
WHERE id IN (
  SELECT id FROM queue_classic_jobs
  WHERE locked_at IS NULL AND q_name = $1 AND scheduled_at <= now()
  LIMIT 1
  FOR NO KEY UPDATE SKIP LOCKED
)
RETURNING *
```

comment.body:
If someone do it, it would be interesting to see benchmarks, because from experience this is the bottleneck with a lot of load...when we had say over 100 workers hitting `lock_head` at the same time, lock_head was using a lot of the DB CPU time.

What do you think @senny?

comment.body:
Ah...ah...ah... :P

For anyone coming here, I presented that project at a local meetup. I am French Canadian (as everyone is at that meetup). I thought that "dix-patch" would be a good name, as in french it would be pronounced "dispatch"...but as you can imagine, someone in the assistance made me realize how it would be pronounced in English...

We laughed very hard at my first slide (a 5 minute prep slide deck), as it's the worst slide ever, for various reasons, including the name.

Won't merge buddy, but...thanks....?!? :stuck_out_tongue:

issue.title: define and document the API structure

milestone.title: 0.1 - Ready to try on small apps
milestone.description:
Very first version can support only identification of users, and send them to Intercom and Mixpanel only. Next step would be tracking events in the backend. Everything front-end related is for later.

For now, Forwardlytics supports only one project at a time. The configuration is all in environment variables, no database or anything.

comment.body:
At first, I think...

What we take from the API:

```
{
  context: {}, // optionnal, but can have IP of the user, user agent, version of the library used, etc
  timestamp: 123, // when the event triggered
  userID: 'some-user-id',
  userTraits: {} // User traits, most are custom. Some are required, per integration
}
```

What we send to the integrations:

```
{
  context: {}, // optionnal, but can have IP of the user, user agent, version of the library used, etc
  timestamp: 123, // when the event triggered
  userID: 'some-user-id',
  receivedAt: 123, // when Forwardlytics received the event
  userTraits: {} // User traits, most are custom. Some are required, per integration
}
```

issue.title: define and document the API structure

milestone.description:
Very first version can support only identification of users, and send them to Intercom and Mixpanel only. Next step would be tracking events in the backend. Everything front-end related is for later.

For now, Forwardlytics supports only one project at a time. The configuration is all in environment variables, no database or anything.

comment.body:
For now, probably just something in the README, as it might change a lot before 0.1, and before 1.0...and possibly Apiary + Blueprint. At least, that's what I had in mind. I'll look at RAML though.

Thanks!

issue.title: Make QC a bit thread safe
issue.body:
Related to #247.

Use thread local storage to save the configuration of the connection. This *DOES NOT* make QC fully thread safe. For instance, the default queue is stored globally. It's however unlikely that someone is using a different default queue per thread.

comment.body: @malclocke just FYI, this does NOT make QC thread safe, it improves the situation, but does NOT fix it. I don't think QC is threadsafe at this point.

issue.title: Email notifications?
issue.body:
Hey,
love what you did! I'm not using it yet but plan on doing it very soon. One thing that is missing IMHO is the ability to subscribe via email to the status updates. I know this is hosted on GitHub pages, so this is a bit tricky. Here is an idea I had. It's a bit hacky, I must admit, and totally incomplete.

- Have an RSS feed of the incidents
- Have a MailChimp account, or something similar, and integrate it with statuspage
- Have _something_ that sends email for new RSS entries

I looked at the MailChimp "RSS to email" feature, but it's not fast enough, it would be a day late, that's useless. It doesn't look like it's possible with IFTTT or Zapier, but I might have missed something.

It would be easy to host a service doing that, but I would prefer not to have to host an app to do that, but have something easy.

Maybe there is nothing that fits the vision you have, but I thought I would share my thoughts and maybe someone can complete those and we can come up with a decent solution :)

Cheers

comment.body: Yeah, same. I actually started to write thinking that MailChimp would work, but before sending it, I double checked, and the fact it is not in near real-time is a killer, and totally agree this should be mad simple to setup and use. Feel free to close in the meantime.

issue.title: Email notifications?
issue.body:
Hey,
love what you did! I'm not using it yet but plan on doing it very soon. One thing that is missing IMHO is the ability to subscribe via email to the status updates. I know this is hosted on GitHub pages, so this is a bit tricky. Here is an idea I had. It's a bit hacky, I must admit, and totally incomplete.

- Have an RSS feed of the incidents
- Have a MailChimp account, or something similar, and integrate it with statuspage
- Have _something_ that sends email for new RSS entries

I looked at the MailChimp "RSS to email" feature, but it's not fast enough, it would be a day late, that's useless. It doesn't look like it's possible with IFTTT or Zapier, but I might have missed something.

It would be easy to host a service doing that, but I would prefer not to have to host an app to do that, but have something easy.

Maybe there is nothing that fits the vision you have, but I thought I would share my thoughts and maybe someone can complete those and we can come up with a decent solution :)

Cheers

issue.title: Disable Disqus comments

How do I disable Disqus comments entirely? Leaving the Disqus without configuration results in a javascript error:

    GET http://.disqus.com/embed.js net::ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED

issue.title: Disable Disqus comments
issue.body:
How do I disable Disqus comments entirely? Leaving the Disqus without configuration results in a javascript error:

    GET http://.disqus.com/embed.js net::ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED

comment.body:
There are two, can't remember which one is which, but worst case overwrite both or look in the code to see which one is the one you want.

https://github.com/jipiboily/monologue/blob/master/app/views/layouts/monologue/application/_disqus.html.erb
https://github.com/jipiboily/monologue/blob/master/app/views/layouts/monologue/application/_disqus_embed.html.erb

Feel free to reopen if it doesn't work, or send a PR adding an option for it.

issue.title: Disable Disqus comments
issue.body:
How do I disable Disqus comments entirely? Leaving the Disqus without configuration results in a javascript error:

    GET http://.disqus.com/embed.js net::ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED

comment.body: I don't think there is any option for that. You could overwrite the disqu partial, at the exact same path in your app, with an empty file.
